This week‚Äôs activity will be held at the church. We‚Äôll begin with a service project in the nursery room, then head to the gym for a fun game of dodgeball.

item.content:encoded:
üçì YOU‚ÄôRE INVITED! üç´

CHOPPED JR. ‚Äì NO-BAKE EDITION

Think you‚Äôve got what it takes to be the next no-bake master chef? Grab your apron and bring your creativity!

item.title: A Mighty Change of Heart
Pool Party
Outdoor Movie
The Floor
Ice Blocking
item.content:encoded:
‚ùÑÔ∏è Chill Thrills Alert! ‚ùÑÔ∏è

YOU‚ÄôRE INVITED TO THE COOLEST EVENT OF THE SUMMER‚Ä¶ ICE BLOCKING!

When: Wed 5/07 at 7:00 PM (sharp‚Ä¶ or risk melting ü´†) Where: Cortessa Park ‚Äì Meet at the basketball court! Pickup: 8:00 PM (Parents/rides: We‚Äôll thaw out by then, promise).

What to bring: üíß Water (stay hydrated, not frostbitten). ü©≥ A towel (for sitting on‚Ä¶ or dramatic post-slide poses).

What I‚Äôll bring: üßä 6 GIANT ICE BLOCKS (first come, first slide!).

The Plan:

  1. Grab a block.
  2. Find the steepest hill.
  3. SIT, SLIDE, REPEAT (until the ice‚Äîor your courage‚Äîruns out).

Warning: You will get wet. You might laugh until you cry. You‚Äôll definitely bond over shared regret (and laughter).

RSVP: Just show up‚Ä¶ but bring your need for speed!

P.S. Friends welcome! The more, the slippier! üòâ

See you on the slopes (aka Cortessa‚Äôs legendary hills)!

‚Äì Jaxton Hernandez

item.title: Grill'n and S'mores

item.title: Easter Pageant
item.content:encoded:
Upcoming Combined Activity ‚Äì Thursday, April 17

Details:

  • Time: 5:00 PM
  • Location: Church Building
  • Note: This activity is scheduled for Thursday (instead of the usual day) due to no school on Good Friday.

Event Information:

  • We‚Äôll be joining the YW1 class for a combined activity.
  • The pageant begins at 8:00 PM, but since it‚Äôs pretty close to Easter, we‚Äôd like to arrive early to secure good seating and avoid the crowds.

What to Bring/Prepare:

  • Snacks & Water: Please have your kids eat beforehand and/or bring light snacks and water.
  • Jackets: The forecast predicts windy weather, so a jacket is recommended.
  • Attire: No strict dress code, but we encourage respectful and comfortable clothing.

We‚Äôre looking forward to a wonderful evening together! Let us know if you have any questions.

item.title: Ping-pong Tournement
item.description: Ping Pong Tournament: Nixon Claims Victory
item.content:encoded:
Ping Pong Tournament: Nixon Claims Victory The Ping Pong tournament delivered intense competition, with Nixon emerging as the champion.

Thrilling Matches

  • Lucas and Kobe kicked off the action with a nail-biter, as Lucas edged out Kobe 15-13. They were fated to meetup again in the lower bracket, with Lucas defeating Kobe again 16-14.
  • Pierce fought hard in the lower bracket, narrowly beating Dalan 12-10 and then Keyton 12-10.

Finals In the championship match, Nixon showcased their dominance, defeating Lucas 11-8 to secure the title.

Standouts Nixon: Undefeated and unstoppable, claiming the crown. Lucas: Resilient, battling through the lower bracket. Kallen: Strong performances, reaching the semifinals. Kobe: Put up a fierce fight in two tight matches against Lucas. Pierce: Showed grit in the lower bracket with back-to-back close victories. Keyton: Delivered a solid performance, including an 11-7 win over Tucker.

Congratulations to Nixon and all players for an exciting tournament!

item.title: Street Hockey
item.description: For our activity this week we will be playing street hockey.
item.content:encoded:
For our activity this week we will be playing street hockey.

We will meet at the park in Cortessa at 7 p.m. and wrap up at 8 p.m.

If your boys have a hockey stick, they can bring it.

item.title: Citrus Picking
item.description: Bishop was finally able to coordinate with Sister Madeline Smith, and I went over to visit her to discuss scheduling.
item.content:encoded:
Bishop was finally able to coordinate with Sister Madeline Smith, and I went over to visit her to discuss scheduling.

Important Change: We‚Äôll be meeting at 5:30 PM tonight instead of the usual 7:00 PM due to how early it gets dark. Having more daylight will likely help us be more productive.

Here are the details:

Subject: Fruit Picking at Sister Madeline Smith‚Äôs

  • Location: Sister Madeline Smith‚Äôs home (near Ken off 183rd).
  • Access: The south gate will be left unlocked for us to drive in. The fruit trees are accessible from there.
  • Fruit Details:
    • 6 fruit trees (type unknown) need to be picked.
    • Sister Smith will keep some fruit for juicing but has indicated there will be plenty to share.
    • Everyone who participates can likely take home a bag of citrus.

Logistics:

  • Meeting Point: Ken‚Äôs house at 5:30 PM.
  • Agenda:
    • Start with prayer and a brief message about service/priesthood responsibilities.

Supplies Needed:

  • We will provide:
    • 10 buckets
    • A couple of boxes for fruit
    • 2 ladders
  • Participants should bring:
    • Headlamps or flashlights
    • Gloves
    • Pole pickers (if available) to reach high fruit.

Looking forward to working together on this service opportunity!
